entry.title: Add `TextDiffRange`
entry.content:
`CharacterData` instance methods such as `appendData`[1] has

an optimization for `LayoutText` by passing where in the text

was deleted or inserted. But different layers have slightly

different signatures, and `new_size` is lost before it reaches

`LayoutText`.



This patch adds `TextDiffRange` which represents a deletion

and/or an insertion to a string, and pass it down to

`LayoutText` and `InlineNode`.



This patch has no behavior changes.



[1] https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CharacterData



Bug: 325517313

Change-Id: Iedd5a5186aa22e1baea4810de6f36824a8786d74

entry.title: Add gn2bp checker to CI
entry.content:
* Implemented a GN2BP validation script that would generate the desc_*.json

files on the fly during execution then run `gn2bp` script and make sure that it

executes with no error. This will allow the Cronet team to catch any changes to

the script as early as possible which decreases the time to import significantly.



* After this change, the gn2bp source of truth will be in Chromium and it should be

only used from Chromium.



* Add the new target to the CI(temporarily) until we have calculated how often

does it fail and if it's reasonable to switch it over to CQ.



Bug: 1523214

entry.title: Observe the pop-up's WebContentsDestroyed() and trigger an
entry.content:
UnmaskCardRequest for the VCN 3DS



This CL observes the pop-up's WebContentsDestroyed() and triggers an

UnmaskCardRequest for the VCN 3DS flow. If the pop-up's web contents are

destroyed, we must retrieve the most up to date URL. If the URL's query

parameters are present and they match the case that denotes the user

successfully completed the authentication, we need to trigger an

UnmaskCardRequest.

entry.title: [PIX] Handle the case of multiple PIX codes on the page.
entry.content:
Before this patch, when FacilitatedPaymentsAgent was looking up a PIX

code on the page, it picked the first string with "0014br.gov.bcb.pix"

substring and then validated it. If the code was invalid, the

FacilitatedPaymentsAgent returned the "invalid PIX code found" status

code, even if the page had a valid PIX code elsewhere, which can happen

if the page displays a truncated PIX code and has a hidden
or

with the un-truncated (valid) PIX code.



This patch adds a validator function to the

WebNode::FindTextInElementWith(substring) method to make it return the

text only if the validator returns "true" for the given text.



After this patch, if multiple PIX codes are found on the page, then the

FacilitatedPaymentsAgent returns the first _valid_ PIX code.



Bug: 324765365

entry.title: Prevent ~FileUploadDelegate crash
entry.content:
`FileUploadDelegate` activity is performed on UI thread, but destructions

may be initiated from elsewhere (as generic `FileUploadJob::Delegate`

that is not associated with UI thread in any way).



To prevent DCHECK from crashing, Delegate is now always assigned to a

sequenced task runner (UI in prod), to be deleted there.



Also, additional UI-affinity checks are added.



Tested manually on VM

entry.title: [soft navigations] Nested event scopes share PerInteractionData
entry.content:
This CL makes nested EventScopes for the same SoftNavigationHeuristics

object conceptually part of the same interaction by sharing the same

PerInteractionData. This is accomplished by changing how the

last_interaction_task_id_ is managed:

- Clear it for a "new interaction" in the outermost scope, which will

be clicks, keydown, and non-nested navigate events. Note: we still

clear this as well in ResetHeuristic(), which happens when a soft

nav is detected or all pending potential soft root tasks have been

GCed.



- Set it, along with creating the PerInteractionData for the potential

soft nav, in the first event listener under any EventScope for the

interaction. If one gets created during a click/keyboard event, it

will get reused by the navigation scope. If one didn't get created

because no listeners ran, it will get created if a navigate event

listener runs.



This CL also centralizes where PerInteractionData is created.

Previously it was created in both OnCreateEventScope and

InteractionCallbackCalled, which was only called from the former.



Bug: 40942324

Change-Id: Iac162960c1209e18d8c0f75f2cbfbbc782eedcd3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5295234

Reviewed-by: Ian Clelland

Reviewed-by: Michal Mocny

Commit-Queue: Scott Haseley

entry.title: Provide way to construct span from string literal without string_view
entry.content:
A span can be constructed to point to a string literal but excluding

the NUL terminator by going through string_view, but that is not

optimal. It can relocate the literal, and it loses the compile-time

size. Provide instead:



- span_from_cstring("hello world") to make a span, where

N is the number of characters before the NUL terminator.

where N is the number of characters before the NUL terminator.

entry.title: FLEDGE: Change how tracing works for scoring multi-bid.
entry.content:
Currently, when multiple bids are generated for a single BidState due

to a k-anon re-run, trace_id_for_kanon_scoring is used to trace

the re-run's scoring. This, however, does not scale to generateBid()

returning multiple bids that need to be scored.



So instead, just use a separate trace ID (and a new "score" event_name)

for scoring every bid, no matter how many there are, and store the id in

the corresponding Bid objects.

entry.title: Remove corb_detachable.
entry.content:
This is part of cleanup work to remove CORB code, now that its successor ORB has been enabled. This particular CL removes rarely used functionality that we won't need going forward.



This CL should be largely functionally neutral, but it affects two tests:



- One subtest in PrefetchBrowserTest: It seems the test inadvertently

relied on caching behaviour of ORB-blocked requests. By changing

the content type to the empty string the resource is not affected

by ORB at all, and the test should work as originally intended.



- WPT preload/prefetch-document: The test assertions for cross-origin

resources are not ORB compatible, because ORB would block those

resources. The change here makes us pass the test 100%; makes

Firefox (which has also implemented ORB) pass an additional subtest,

and doesn't affect WebKit (which apparently doesn't implement

prefetch).



Ref: https://wpt.fyi/results/preload/prefetch-document.html?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=preload%2Fprefetch-document.html



Bug: 324418206

entry.title: base_perftests: Register google_benchmark tests as gtests
entry.content:
Currently BENCHMARK(BM_ReturnIfError_Ok) expands as:



static ::benchmark::internal::Benchmark*

benchmark_uniq_2_benchmark_ [[maybe_unused]] =

(::benchmark::internal::RegisterBenchmarkInternal(

new ::benchmark::internal::FunctionBenchmark(

"BM_ReturnIfError_Ok",

BM_ReturnIfError_Ok)));



This registers the benchmark function in a global instance during static

init.



The main() in run_all_perftests.cc runs all tests. It allows matching

tests via a commandline flag parsed by google_benchmark, but the

google_benchmark flags ignore gtest flags.



To run some specific test from base_perftests on Android we do:



```

autoninja -C out/AndroidReleaseOfficial base_perftests

out/AndroidReleaseOfficial/bin/run_base_perftests \

'--gtest_filter=MyBenchmark*' -v

```



This asks the binary to --gtest_list_tests before attempting to run any

existing gtest benchmark. As we learned above, google_benchmark parts

ignore this gtest flag and proceed with running all registered

benchmarks. This hits a timeout of 30 seconds on a modern device because

we hardcoded warmup to take at least 24 seconds in

big_endian_perftest.cc.



It would be nice to keep the legacy --gtest_filter interface in a

working state during transition.



As a quick fix I suggest to remove the 31 second delay by registering

the google_benchmark functions inside gtest, like so:

```

TEST(ExpectedMacrosPerfTest, BM_ReturnIfError_Ok) {

BENCHMARK(BM_ReturnIfError_Ok);

}

```



This is a change to do so for base_perftests.



Bug: b/40251982

Change-Id: Ibee0912fa1b6dfc0593bc55a54309002f9a0e950

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5300560

Reviewed-by: Peter Kasting

Commit-Queue: Egor Pasko

Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1261706}

entry.title: [android] Fix generated password saved to local PasswordStore
entry.content:
Before this CL, a syncing user with UsesSplitStoresAndUPMForLocal()

true was saving generated passwords to the local store. However,

generated passwords should always be saved to a Google Account, to

avoid loss when the device is replaced. This CL fixes the bug.



The underlying issue is that the enum PasswordAccountStorageUsageLevel

exposes kUsingAccountStorage and kSyncing as 2 different things [1] and

generation was relying on this enum. With this CL, the code depends on

IsOptedInForAccountStorage() instead, which does return true for

syncing users with split stores.



Funnily, the above was the status quo before crrev.com/c/3488166. It

got changed due to a quirk: IsOptedInForAccountStorage() used to return true for syncing users who previously opted in to account storage. That

caused such users to generate to the wrong store (crbug.com/1275457).

The quirk is gone since crrev.com/c/4969376, so we can safely revert

to IsOptedInForAccountStorage() now.



Medium term, we should revisit PasswordAccountStorageUsageLevel and its

friend PasswordAccountStorageUserState. I audited current uses and the

only remaining non-metric use is [2], which I'll tackle in a separate

CL.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/password_manager/core/browser/features/password_manager_features_util.h;l=48;drc=1701fd99b91dd2ea8deb3d8744a0bbffc36d02fa

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/password_manager/core/browser/sharing/password_receiver_service_impl.cc;l=289;drc=1701fd99b91dd2ea8deb3d8744a0bbffc36d02fa



Fixed: 325276671

Change-Id: I2bf3cc885220e06d616bc8cf45b4d29b2e015b48

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5296321

entry.title: Ensure last TabStrip event filter resize occurs on automotive.
entry.content:
The last #onViewportChanged() doesn't seem to trigger normally, since it's comparing the new cachedVisibleViewport top with the old cachedWindowViewport top, even though that value gets zeroed out much earlier when scrolling off the top browser controls. This means that the last resize for the tab strip event filter is missed, leading to a small offset of a few pixels, with a persisting small band of the event filter that is still tappable even after the event filter is hidden.



Note that this only happens on certain screen densities, since on some other screen densities an unusual pxToDp value will ensure that (width != previousWidth) is true at every #onViewportResize(), letting it trigger correctly but for the wrong reason.



Reproduced on auto:

https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NjI5NzM1MTI2NTE4OTg4OHwxMjFhYThhMC0wZQ



Fixed on auto: https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NDc5NjU5MTE3NjE1NTEzNnw5Y2I3MTk5MC02MQ



Reproduced on Pixel with modified density:

https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NjA4MzYxNjUxMjY3MTc0NHw0ZmUxMzVmNS1iMw

entry.title: [bookmarks] Prefer reassigning IDs for local bookmarks over account ones
entry.content:
Normally there should be no ID collisions across two JSON files. When

they do exist (corruption state), IDs must be reassigned in at least one

of them so BookmarkModel can adhere to ID-uniqueness invariants.



Which of the two files gets the IDs reassigned is somewhat arbitrary,

but in most cases it is less harmful to reassign them to the JSON file

containing local-or-syncable bookmarks. This is because doing the same

for account bookmarks almost certainly leads to having to redownload

data from the Sync server, with its own caveats (data usage,

potentially lost local changes if pending, etc.).



There is one scenario where this "edge" case may be hit consistently:

the current plan is to eventually migrate iOS to also adopt a single

BookmarkModel instance. In this one-off transition, users will almost

certainly run into ID collisions exactly once. In this scenario, as

per rationale above, it is safer to reassign IDs for the

local-or-syncable JSON file.



Change-Id: Icc844569961a1b85de93c385a71b3dfabeace4f1

entry.title: Cleanup bind_internal.h and bind_unittest.cc in advance of other CLs.
entry.content:
* Use macros for repeated blocks inside bind_internal.h. This will pay

off when adding more qualifiers (e.g. & and &&) in the future.

* Use `DecayedFunctorTraits<>` and `FunctorTraits<>` instead of

`FunctorTraits<>` and `MakeFunctorTraits<>`, respectively, for the

traits of decayed and undecayed functors. This not only makes the

short and obvious name be the one people should reach for and makes

clearer how these differ, it will help when fixing a bug in decayed

functor handling in the future.

* Remove unnecessary "base::" inside bind_unittest.cc.

entry.title: Check the last proxy server when deciding what connect job to start
entry.content:
The connect job factory creates params from the first proxy server to

the last, resulting in a linked-list of params the head of which

correspond to the _last_ proxy in the list, not the first. So using

`proxy_chain.First()` is a bug.



Instead of just switching this to use `Last()`, check the

`http_proxy_params` for nullness, and only CHECK that the `Last()`

server has the correct scheme, as is already done for socks.



Thanks to mmenke@chromium.org for finding this.



Bug: 1491092

Change-Id: Idbc060ad983de673cf70879162203736e4f6cf99

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5296180

entry.title: Add support for batching Attribution Reporting OS registration URLs
entry.content:
Batching will be important for applying checks that ensure that an input

event is used only once.



This CL adds support for batching the calls but continue making one call

per url.



Android currently has a limit of 20 urls per call. Chromium would need

to also apply this limit to be able to pass all urls in a single call.



A limit increased to 80 was agreed upon. Once this limit will be

implemented in Android, the same limit will be applied in chromium and

multiple urls will be sent with a single call.

the main Profile for this purpose. This CL adopts that behavior on iOS.

entry.title: Randomize token expirations as a batch
entry.content:
This helps get a better distribution of refreshes across clients. Each

client will see the tokens expire from 0-15 minutes before the "actual"

expiration time, and thus likely start a refresh at that time.



If the tokens are randomized individually, then the law of large numbers

says that the earliest token expiration is probably about 15 minutes

before the actual expiration time, and the net result is that all

clients just refresh 15 minutes earlier than they would have otherwise,

without substantially affecting the distribution of refresh times.



Bug: 325000751

Change-Id: Id0808dd97014d2449b5ef8c34c31fa8b9e3c3a06

entry.title: Change semantics of PDMObserver::OnPersonalDataChanged()
entry.content:
Two of the PDMObserver's events are OnPersonalDataChanged() and

OnPersonalDataFinishedProfileTasks(). The goal of these changes is to

remove OnPersonalDataFinishedProfileTasks() and replace its uses with

OnPersonalDataChanged().



Currently, they work as follows:

- OnPersonalDataFinishedProfileTasks() is called when all pending read

and write operations have finished. Contrary to what the name suggest,

this includes non-address related changes; it is blocked on and

triggered by payment related changes.

- OnPersonalDataChanged() is called whenever all pending read operations

have finished, and after every address write operation that finishes.

Moreover, OnPersonalDataChanged() is also called when the user

disables payments sync via settings, since this remasks full server

cards (which are deprecated anyways... see b/40939195).



Some examples:

- pdm.AddProfile(profile1);

pdm.AddProfile(profile2);

Will trigger two OnPersonalDataChanged() events, one after the first

AddProfile() has finished and second one, followed by one

OnPersonalDataFinishedProfileTasks() event*.

- pdm.AddCreditCard(card1);

pdm.AddCreditCard(card2);

Will trigger one OnPersonalDataChanged() and one

OnPersonalDataFinishedProfileTasks() event, once both AddCreditCard()

operations have finished.

- pdm.Refresh()

Same events as in the previous example.



This is confusing and makes go/split-pdm more difficult.



This CL changes the semantics of OnPersonalDataChanged() to

OnPersonalDataFinishedProfileTasks()'s "called when all pending read

and write operations have finished". With this change,

OnPersonalDataFinishedProfileTasks() becomes obsolete and is removed in

crrev.com/c/5291015.



* There are some more special cases when the passed in profile is empty.

In this case, OnPersonalDataChanged() followed by

OnPersonalDataFinishedProfileTasks() is triggered after every add

immediately, since no database is involved/the function early returns.

Similar special cases exist when removing a profile that doesn't

exist, etc.



Bug: b/322170538

Change-Id: I1fcff512fa980acf9485dbd39d91a827f1e9bbb7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5290994

Reviewed-by: Matthias Körber

entry.title: [anchor] Support resolution of anchor*() at computed-value time
entry.content:
This CL adds a runtime flag which causes anchor*() functions

to resolve at computed-value time instead of used-value time.

We achieve this by storing a Length::AnchorEvaluator pointer

on CSSToLengthConversionData, which makes it available when

resolving calc() and other math functions computed-value time.



For now this isn't useful outside of tests, since we don't

propagate a *real* AnchorEvaluator from OutOfFlowLayoutPart

just yet. This means that enabling the runtime flag currently

causes all anchor*() functions to evaluate with a nullptr-

evaluator, resolving to their fallback values.



Note that all call-sites where we instantiate AnchorData

with the default constructor (causing a nullptr-evaluator)

should be fine. The anchor()/anchor-size() functions are only

valid in inset and sizing properties (respectively), so we should

always use the fallback anyway for timeline properties, gradients,

the sizes attribute, filters, font properties and SVG.



Bug: 41483417

Change-Id: Ibb285e10f772530f5c9788c60e054a990c6895d5

entry.title: media/gpu/chromeos: Change UnwrapFrameCB inputs and rename
entry.content:
The UnwrapFrameCB function pointer is used by MailboxVideoFrameConverter

to look up a frame that was wrapped by another frame. This was done by

passing the wrapping frame, getting the shared memory ID of the frame

(which is not affected by wrapping), and looking up the original frame

in a map.



This changes the unwrap functions to accept the ID (in the form of a

gfx::GenericSharedMemoryId) instead of accepting a VideoFrame. It also

switches the key type in OOPVideoDecoder from the alias

gfx::GpuMemoryBufferId to the original type of

gfx::GenericSharedMemoryId.



Since the UnwrapFrameCB and implementations no longer accept a

VideoFrame parameter, it has been renamed GetOriginalFrameCB.



This change makes it cleaner to migrate the MailboxVideoFrameConverter

to use FrameResource instead of VideoFrame.



Bug: b:277581596

Test: Decode tests pass on Cherry and Volteer

Test: media_unittests pass on Volteer

entry.content:

entry.title: Create autofill field promo controller & view
entry.content:
These classes are responsible for showing and hiding IPH bubbles which

need to be attached directly to DOM elements.



The controller will be owned (in a future CL) by the autofill client.

The controller manages hiding and showing the view.



The view is actually an invisible view which completely covers the

bottom boundary of the element. The IPH is then anchored to this view.

This gives the visual impression that the IPH is anchored to the DOM

element.



This code can be used to display multiple IPH's. For every IPH, a new

controller has to be created. The `ElementIdentifier` passed to the

controller dictates which IPH will be shown.



Tested the view by setting a red background to it:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/5KTWrUrHkyzr5vL

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/9F3YBNubowcdG2c



No matter how I moved the window within the screen, the view was always

positioned correctly.



Bug: b/320633297

entry.title: [css-functions] Add implicit calc() as needed.
entry.content:
When resolving a function argument or return value to a given type,

add calc() around it if the type is amenable to it (i.e., is a

numeric type). This makes them much more ergonomic to write, e.g.

instead of writing



@return calc(--foo(calc(arg(--x) * 2)) + 3);



you can write



@return --foo(arg(--x) * 2) + 3;



which is much easier to read.



Since this would leave a stray calc() (e.g. calc(10)) on the return

value if we added it to a non-registered or universal-syntax custom

property, we now also resolve the resulting value against the element

as if it were against a registered custom property of the given type.

This will then also resolve units when possible, further simplifying

the expression.



Bug: 325504770

Change-Id: Ic64984c0db9c5bf33a0d66194a873b8dd0429a5f

entry.title: Revert "[//gpu][mac] Support multiple concurrent read access in Graphite"
entry.content:
This reverts commit d53449b702e7d67460467d25fdb14904bf79bca1.



Reason for revert: It looks like this CL is likely still the source

of crashiness, albeit now the crash is different:



https://crash.corp.google.com/browse?q=product_name%3D%27Chrome_Mac%27+AND+expanded_custom_data.ChromeCrashProto.magic_signature_1.name%3D%27%5BDump+without+crash%5D+dawn%3A%3Anative%3A%3ADeviceBase%3A%3AHandleError%27+AND+expanded_custom_data.ChromeCrashProto.channel%3D%27canary%27+AND+product.Version%3D%27123.0.6304.0%27&stbtiq=&reportid=&index=0#2



Original change's description:

> [//gpu][mac] Support multiple concurrent read access in Graphite

>

> We have discovered that the lack of this support is a source of

> significant overhead for Graphite vs. Ganesh on at least one perf

> benchmark, as this is supported in Ganesh [1].

>

> This function was added here [2]. It's not obvious to me what the

> requirements are for it being able to be supported in a given

> representation. This CL enables it for

> SkiaGraphiteDawnImageRepresentation for Mac. Local testing shows that

> it works unproblematically, including on YouTube and WebGPU's demo

> pages.

>

> NOTE: This CL is a reland of [3] (with the plumbing changes split out

> to a predecessor CL). The test crashes that caused a revert are fixed

> in [4].

>

> [1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:gpu/command_buffer/service/shared_image/iosurface_image_backing.mm;l=373-375;drc=b58207f5aecc39db7d3da766e7d171e5d2c3598e;bpv=1;bpt=1

> [2] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1963098

entry.title: Remove a few vector<const T> that are easy to remove
entry.content:
* A regular vector can be passed to a span no problem

* A const vector already doesn't allow any modifications, making

the T const redundant



(A vector doesn't make a ton of sense generally: Since the

vector itself isn't const and since you can copy into it, you can

modify each element by removing it and putting a modified element

back. That's why a span makes sense but a vector

doesn't.)



No behavior change.



Bug: 323708866

entry.title: Consume the capabilities for minor-mode in the Sync Consent screens.
entry.content:
With minor mode feature enabled, the layout of the buttons depends on

the value of the CanShowHistorySyncOptInsWithoutMinorModeRestrictions

capability or is defaulted to minor-safe mode if that capability is not

available within a fixed timeout. However, the buttons are not recreated until subsequent CL is landed crrev/c/5301385



With minor mode disabled or when there is no account, the behavior stays

unchanged.



Implementation explained: since it's difficult to recolor buttons, they will be replaced instead, but as a consequence, some of button configuration bits (on click listeners, consent trackers) will need to be moved from one button to the other. That functionality is to be landed in crrev/c/5301385.

entry.title: [css-functions] Initial prototype of CSS functions.
entry.content:
This is a very early prototype of user-defined CSS functions, based on

our position paper and behind the flag CSSFunctions. This is mainly

to get experience with the syntax and implementation. It is not suitable

for production use. Among the more important missing parts:



- There is no support for local variables.

- There is no cycle detection (so any attempt at recursion will

trivially crash the renderer).

- The Iverson bracket functions are not supported yet, so any @media

queries or similar will need to be made using helper custom

properties (on :root or similar).

- Style is not properly updated if a @function changes (i.e.,

the stylesheet is replaced)



There is also no support for @function in cascade layers, or in CSSOM.



The syntax may change at any time.



Bug: 325504770

Change-Id: I871d8aa38d9e191f67642b27bc387b57a1803f1b

entry.title: Fix dangling pointers in win_system_signals_service_unittest.cc.
entry.content:
The constructor for the unittest (`WinSystemSignalsServiceTest`),

creates 3 sub-objects owned by unique_ptrs and moves them to

`win_system_signals_service_`. It holds on to the sub-objects via raw_ptr.



This causes dangling pointer detection to fire during test destruction

as the ordering of the member variables (in the unittest) causes the

owning object to be destroyed first (thus making the sub-objects

dangling -- for an instant).



Re-ordering the raw_ptr sub-objects such that they are destroyed first

avoids this problem.



Change-Id: I2cefd9e17c82d9431ed2efd7fae83fbeddf90626

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5301766

Reviewed-by: Colin Blundell

Commit-Queue: Colin Blundell

entry.title: Remove PDMObserver::OnPersonalDataSyncStateChanged()
entry.content:
Only the AutofillPrivateEventRouter is listening for this event. In an

effort to simplify the PDMObserver, as part of go/split-pdm, this CL

removes the event from PDMObserver and instead observes the sync service

from AutofillPrivateEventRouter directly.



As a drive-by clean-up, the existing PDMObserver in

AutofillPrivateEventRouter is refactored to a base::ScopedObservation<>.



Bug: b/322170538

Change-Id: I0ebd362fa78ee227a517ff8b6300e6d29ba66da0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5234272

entry.title: [gbb-cct] Create custom scrim for Page Insights Hub
entry.content:
If the default scrim behaviour is used, when the BottomSheet is in HALF state then the scrim will be visible, which we want to avoid.

The new scrim behaviour will show only when the height of the bottom sheet is between PEEK (excluded) and EXPANDED (included).



Demo with custom scrim: http://shortn/_5WGlLtv66N

entry.title: Eliminate unsafe casts in ChromeImpl
entry.content:
Static casts from the base class to the derived class with the following

access to the derived class members can lead to undefined behavior if

the referred object does not belong to the target type. This commit

improves ChromeDriver code health by eliminating such casts from the

ChromeImpl class.

entry.title: Updates the histogram with new ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism
entry.content:
This CL:

- Segments ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism::kAllowBy3PCDMetadata into:

ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism::kAllowBy3PCDMetadata,

ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism::kAllowBy3PCDMetadataSource1pDt,

and ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism::kAllowBy3PCDMetadataSource3pDt.



- Makes changes to the test helpers to allow for source field setup.



- Fixes Enum label mismatch introduced at https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5201726/9/tools/metrics/histograms/metadata/page/enums.xml



- Creates a new mojom to hold content setting enums single source of truth definitions following https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/mojo.md#using-mojo-enums-directly-when-possible



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.CookieAccess.ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism is replaced by PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.CookieAccess.ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism2



Followup: Migrate the other enums to the new mojom and get rid of duplicate enums defs.

entry.title: Do not wait on frames while the compositor is not visible.
entry.content:
This CL fixes WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnStateUpdate to not try to wait

on frames while the compositor is not visible, because frames will not

be produced in this case. This is safe because even though the state may

have changed significantly, it can never be observed if the compositor

is not visible.
